text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Shar a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Sydney today
I'm going to show you how to view the OS
platform or version that an Amazon
elastic compute Cloud Linux instance is
running let's get
started you can use one of the following
three methods to check the OS and the
version number number view the platform
details of an ec2 instance or the Ami ID
information from the ec2 console view OS
platform details from the instances
console logs or the instances screenshot
view OS platform details from the AWS
systems manager fleet manager console
you can also use AWS command line
interface to get this information let's
look at each method
use the ec2 console to view the platform
details of an ec2 instance or the Ami ID
information you can use the ec2 console
to view the details about the OS
platform of an ec2 instance or the Ami
ID information log in to the Amazon ec2
console and then select the ec2
instance on the details tab view OS and
version information in the platform
details field or select the Ami
ID now AWS has limited visibility into
the software or Os that's running on an
instance this means that AWS can't
provide specific OS related information
AWS predicts the information in the
platform details field based on the Ami
name and the description because of this
the listed platform might not be
accurate view the instances console logs
or instances screenshot you can use
instances console logs or screenshots to
view details about the OS platform
commonly used Linux distributions
support console
logs to view the console output login
into the ec2 console and then select the
ec2 instance choose actions Monitor and
troubleshoot get system Log search for a
keyword such as Linux or kernel to look
in the log entries in this example note
that the OS is Red Hat
9 you can also use a screenshot to get
this information to view a screenshot
select the ec2
instance choose actions
Monitor and troubleshoot get
screenshot search for a keyword such as
Linux or kernel to look in the log
entries in this example note that the OS
is Red Hat
9 view platform details from the AWS
systems manager fleet manager console
you can use the systems manager fleet
manager console to view details about
the OS platform for an instance to
appear as a managed node under the AWS
systems manager fleet manager it must be
managed by AWS systems manager this
means that instances must be running and
having the Amazon SSM agent installed
they must also have the required AWS
identity and access management
permissions assigned to
them to view platform information for
AWS systems manager managed notes follow
these steps open the AWS systems manager
console and navigate to fleet
manager select the instance the instance
platform type and platform name appear
note that the platform version doesn't
appear by default choose the preference
button and toggle the visibility of the
platform version
you can also use AWS SSM AWS CLI command
on the managed instances to retrieve the
platform details of the instance run the
following
command so now you know how to view the
OS platform or the version that an ec2
Linux instance is
running thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
